pullRequest.body:
Split the section on local properties in general and the properties that satisfy local properties in `LocalProperties.lean` into separate files.

See the discussions [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16558#discussion_r1761381528).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

`+ RingHom.finite_localizationPreserves`
`+ RingHom.finite_ofLocalizationSpan`
`+ RingHom.localization_away_map_finite`

`+ isReduced_localizationPreserves`
`+ surjective_localizationPreserves`
`- finite_ofLocalizationSpan`
`- instance [IsReduced R] : IsReduced (Localization M)`
`- localizationPreserves_surjective`
`- localization_away_map_finite`
`- localization_finite`
`- localization_finiteType`
`- localization_isReduced`
`- surjective_ofLocalizationSpan`
`- surjective_respectsIso`
<details>

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

LGTM, thanks!

@erdOne do you agree with this splitting?

> Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.

OK. I will move these properties in a follow-up PR.

> > Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.
> 
> OK. I will move these properties in a follow-up PR.

I'd still prefer to move all `RingHom` related declarations to the respective `RingTheory/RingHom/` files for this PR.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11016583008/job/30592446120)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11016583008/job/30592445581)
Thanks again for doing this. LGTM!

Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.
I only have a few minor comments, other than that LGTM. In particular I verified that no declarations were lost.
Thanks again for doing this. LGTM!
I would even split each of these sections into separate files and shave imports using `#min_imports` to see if that is meaningful or not.
I think this should go into `RingTheory.RingHom.Surjective` instead.
I think this should go into `RingTheory.RingHom.FiniteType` instead.
Also this could go into `RingTheory.RingHom.Finite` instead.

```suggestion
  proven yet. However, it is used to prove a fundamental property of `IsIntegrallyClosed`,
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```
We should fix the naming of these at some point. It should be called `isReduced_localizationPreserves`, but this can be in a later PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Mathlib/RingTheory/LocalProperties): split LocalProperties.lean

nodes.body:
LGTM, thanks!

@erdOne do you agree with this splitting?

Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.

> Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.

OK. I will move these properties in a follow-up PR.

> > Thanks for doing this! I think some of the new files could go in existing files instead (everything about `RingHom`s), because we have most of the local results there already. If you want, you could do a second move (but maybe rather in a follow-up PR) and factor out the local parts of all `RingHom` files in analogs in the `LocalProperties` folder.
> 
> OK. I will move these properties in a follow-up PR.

I'd still prefer to move all `RingHom` related declarations to the respective `RingTheory/RingHom/` files for this PR.
I only have a few minor comments, other than that LGTM. In particular I verified that no declarations were lost.
Thanks again for doing this. LGTM!
bors merge
